name: df-ushgr
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2
body: |- wceq(cushgr, cab(s0, wsbc(s1, cfv(cvtx, cv(s0)), wsbc(s2, cfv(ciedg, cv(s0)), wf1(cv(s2), cdm(cv(s2)), cdif(cpw(cv(s1)), csn(emptycls)))))))
bodyPretty: ⊢ USHGraph = { s0 |[(Vtx ` s0)/ s1][(iEdg ` s0)/ s2](s2 : dom(s2)↣(P(s1)\ { ∅ }))}
comment: Define the class of all undirected simple hypergraphs. An undirected simple hypergraph is a special (non-simple, multiple, multi-) hypergraph for which the edge function ` e ` is an injective (one-to-one) function into subsets of the set of vertices ` v ` , representing the (one or more) vertices incident to the edge. This definition corresponds to the definition of hypergraphs in section I.1 of [Bollobas] p. 7 (except that the empty set seems to be allowed to be an "edge") or section 1.10 of [Diestel] p. 27, where "E is a subset of [[...] the power set of V, that is the set of all subsets of V" resp. "the elements of E are nonempty subsets (of any cardinality) of V". (Contributed by AV, 19-Jan-2020.) (Revised by AV, 8-Oct-2020.)
